message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.IR 

This paper is about relation classification in natural language processing, which falls under the category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The paper proposes a novel neural network architecture that uses long short term memory (LSTM) units to classify relations along the shortest dependency path (SDP) between two entities in a sentence. This involves information integration from heterogeneous sources, which suggests that the paper could also be relevant to machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The use of dropout regularization to alleviate overfitting is another indication of machine learning techniques being used. Additionally, the paper evaluates its proposed model on the SemEval 2010 relation classification task, which involves text classification, suggesting that the paper could also be relevant to information retrieval (cs.IR).
